puzzle.title: Knock Knock
puzzle.hint:
Identify the pictures on the left, then draw a straight line to connect each of those words with the appropriate response on the right. Keep in mind that every connection will be in the form of a [knock-knock joke](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knock-knock_joke)!
For example, the second picture on the left shows some *FIGS*. That connects with the first response on the right: "Fix the doorbell, it's broken!"

The words for all the pictures on the left are:
- CASH - FIGS - TANK - DOUGHNUT - POLICE - LETTUCE - [DEWEY](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Huey,_Dewey,_and_Louie) - ORANGE - GOAT

The complete list of connections is:
- CASH - Cash who? ("cashew") - I always knew you were a nut! - FIGS -- Fix the doorbell, it's broken! - TANK - Tank who? ("thank you") - You're welcome! - DOUGHNUT -- Do not ask, it's a secret. - POLICE -- Please may I come in? - LETTUCE -- Let us in, we're freezing. - [DEWEY](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Huey,_Dewey,_and_Louie) -- Do we have to keep telling silly jokes. - ORANGE -- Aren't you glad I'm here? - GOAT -- Go to the door and find out.
puzzle.solution: Look at the lines you drew to connect each pair of dots. There should be five letters at line intersections, and when read top to bottom they spell: CANOE ("Can you come out and play?")
